p: Estimates of average within population diversity and total diversity for both cpDNA and ITS were very high in G. przewalskii (cpDNA: h S = 0.330, h T = 0.866; ITS: h S = 0.458, h T = 0.872). For ITS data, N ST (0.873) was significantly larger than G ST (0.474) ( p = 0.005 < 0.01), indicating the presence of significant phylogeographic structure across the species’ range. In contrast, we did not observe N ST (0.700) significantly larger than G ST (0.619) in the cpDNA data.
